intro: Glossostelma ceciliae, commonly known as the Cecilia's star-of-Bahia, is a striking member of the Acanthaceae family native to Brazil. It is characterized by its vibrant, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often with contrasting purple markings. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as forest understories, and prefers well-drained, loamy soil. Its foliage consists of lance-shaped leaves with a velvety texture, adding to its ornamental appeal. Due to its unique appearance and habitat specificity, it is a sought-after plant among botanical enthusiasts and conservationists.
